title: Game of Thrones script reveals deleted detail that drove Daenerys to burn King's Landing
text:

There's no way everyone was going to be happy when we said goodbye to Westeros.

Few could have predicted, however, that Game of Thrones would come to such a divisive end when it wrapped up its eighth and final season earlier this year.

Now all of the scripts for the final season have been released to the Writer's Guild of America Library, Insider has revealed a number of intriguing details from the script, including a moment that didn't make it to screen.

One of these includes an unseen moment from the controversial penultimate episode of the show, The Bells, which sees Queen Daenerys Targaryen ( Emilia Clarke ) give into her worst impulses and wipe out the followers of Queen Cersei Lannister (Lena Headey) and other innocent citizens of King's Landing.

The moment takes place after Arya is persuaded by The Hound to leave the Red Keep and abandon her plans of revenge.

(Image: HBO)

The script says the focus is "tight on flying Dany as she looks at the exterior of the Throne Room, the room her ancestors built."

It is here that Dany sees the lion sigil of House Lannister in the windows where the Seven-Pointed Star once was, seeing this as a "symbol of everything that has been taken from her."

It is seeing this detail that "drives her to fury."

The Dragon Queen then begins to burn down the towers of the Red Keep and wiping out all those inside the fortress.

Well, that certainly adds some more context to her actions!

It should be noted that despite her actions in The Bells, we don't see much of Daenerys' reactions and physical behaviour up close, so this would have let us see more of what was going through her head.

Do you think this detail would have improved the final season of Game of Thrones? Let us know in the comments below.
description: Game of Thrones season 8 saw Daenerys Targaryen (Emilia Clarke) make some highly controversial choices
